item.title: Ticket #9624 (AX88772B USB Ethernet. Read::MISMATCH of the frame length) created
item.dc:creator: kallisti5
item.description:
Asus USB Ethernet dongle using the usb_asix driver.

Get a large number of the following error paired with stalling network communications:

KERN: usb_asix:06.09.160:Read::MISMATCH of the frame length: hdr 153; received:154

hdr is always one less than received.

item.title: Ticket #9623 (Add GitHub to list of code search locations) created
item.dc:creator: waddlesplash
item.description:
GitHub now has a code search feature. You can search Haiku's code there by going here:

​https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Ahaiku%2Fhaiku&type=Code

...and adding your search term to the box.

item.title: Ticket #5369 (BGLView glitch) closed
item.dc:creator: kallisti5
item.description:
fixed:

Likely. All of our viewport math was redone.

If this still exists, please reopen or submit a new case mentioning this one.

Thanks!

item.title: Ticket #9622 (no sound on Thinkpad x120e in hrev45438 gcc2h) created
item.dc:creator: tidux
item.description: This laptop has probably one of the screwier edge cases for the HDA driver - it has a primary sound card with speaker and headphone output, and a second sound card that allows HDMI audio output. Both of these use the HDA driver on Linux. Only one soundcard shows up under Haiku. The only output listed is "left headphones," but no sound actually comes out of the headphone port on the left side of the system. Attached are the syslog, sysinfo, and listdev for the machine in question.

item.title: Ticket #9621 (Tracker and MediaPlayer don't recognize filetype without extension) created
item.dc:creator: Kev
item.description: In the BeOS days, one of the cool features was that the system knew what a file was without an extension. As such, I have many files around without extensions. If I try to open one of these on hrev45407, MediaPlayer says it's not a known type, and Tracker's Identify command does not change the file icon. I rename the file with '.mp4', and MediaPlayer plays it fine, and its icon changes in Tracker. After that I can even rename it back to having no extension, and it still works.

item.title: Ticket #9620 (DiskProbe ignores mouse wheel events) created
item.dc:creator: waddlesplash
item.description: Scrollbars do nothing as well, but I'd like the mouse wheel more.

item.title: Ticket #9619 (Haiku does not have POSIX's ptrace library) created
item.dc:creator: waddlesplash
item.description: Some applications rely on it (e.g. Qt Creator).

item.title: Ticket #9618 (Display DataTranslators in a tree view) created
item.dc:creator: waddlesplash
item.description: Right now it makes no sense to have "StyledEdit files" right next to "TGA images". They should be grouped in a tree view based on category (e.g. "images", "text documents" or something like that).

item.title: Ticket #9617 (Several FSs put/free the root node in unmount()) created
item.dc:creator: bonefish
item.description: At a quick glance several FSs (at least rootfs, devfs, bfs, reiserfs, maybe others) put or free their root node in their unmount() hook. Since the VFS calls the put_vnode() or remove_vnode() hook for each node before calling unmount(), all nodes have already been freed at that time, though.

item.dc:creator: xyzzy
item.description: invalid

item.description: duplicate

item.title: Ticket #9603 (Built-in card reader KDLs when card inserted) closed

ah. This is a 100% duplicate of my issue :D

item.title: Ticket #9616 (MediaConverter doesn't convert to OGG or MP3 and converts to WAV with ...) created
item.dc:creator: Kev
item.description:
I tried converting some MP4 videos to audio-only ogg vorbis or MPEG w/ AC-3 (same as MP3?). Every file I tried resulted in a small file (only a few kb) quickly created.

Raw audio in a WAV container worked; however, despite "no video" in the video encoding section, the WAV files, when opened in MediaPlayer, show the original video somehow. (I didn't even know WAV could do that.)

The MP4s in question play fine in MediaPlayer, which also plays other OGGs just fine.

hrev45413 gcc4hybrid. AC '97 Audio, Dolby 5.1 (6-channel)

item.title: Ticket #9615 (MediaPlayer crashes on video change) created
item.dc:creator: Kev
item.description:
Hadn't had this happen before, but I have a few .mp4 videos, and if I put them in a playlist and hit the next-track button, or let the video play until it finishes and goes to the next track, it crashes immediately.

If I put a non-video in the playlist, moving from the non-video to a video works fine, but moving from a video to anything else produces this crash.

hrev45413 gcc4hybrid.

item.title: Ticket #9614 (Haiku will no longer boot on ThinkPad X41) created
item.dc:creator: Kev
item.description: Haiku was booting at one point on my HDD-less X41. Lately however no matter whether I use a USB stick or an external USB cardreader with an SD card, on hrev45413 gcc4hybrid, all the icons light up on the boot screen and then I get this (attached)

item.title: Ticket #9613 (WebPositive often forgets logon credentials, despite option checked) created
item.dc:creator: Kev
item.description:
The past bunch of times I've visited dev.haiku-os.org and clicked "Log in" I've had to re-enter my name and password, despite every time checking off the "remember" option. It's not every time, though, and it remembers during a session at least (like if I open a new tab, I'm logged in already.) But it does seem that most times that I reboot the computer it forgets, if not all.

hrev45413 gcc4hybrid. Any clues?

item.title: Ticket #9612 (CSS3 Gradients are broken) created
item.dc:creator: waddlesplash
item.description: They don't render correctly. See background on ​http://html5test.com or navbar and dropdowns at ​https://github.com for examples.

item.title: Ticket #9611 ("about:blank" in Web+ opens Haiku about dialog...) created
item.dc:creator: waddlesplash
item.description: ...instead of showing a blank page.

item.title: Ticket #9610 (Folders on desktop don't have the "directory up" button in Tracker) created
item.dc:creator: waddlesplash
item.description:
1. Enable navigator interface in Tracker preferences
  2. Create a folder on the desktop
  3. Double-click to open in a Tracker window
  4. The "up" button is disabled.

You can also open by opening your Home directory, double-clicking Desktop, then double-clicking the folder. The up button will be disabled, the back button will not be.

item.title: Ticket #9609 (BootManager in Haiku x86_64 Installer is not available) closed
item.dc:creator: anevilyak
item.description:
invalid:

Please don't file tickets for missing components on x86-64. There is already a ticket tracking the list of those, and there are a lot of components from a standard Haiku install that are not yet 64-bit safe. As an end user, there is simply no good reason to be using it at the moment, the images are primarily available for development testing and nothing more at this point.

item.title: Ticket #9609 (BootManager in Haiku x86_64 Installer is not available) created
item.dc:creator: Luposian
item.description:
When I go to install a boot menu, using Haiku x86_64's Installer, it says it's not available. Or, more precisely, it says it exactly this way:

"BootManager, the application to configure
the Haiku boot menu, could not be
launched."

I end up having to use the standard Haiku's (x86) Installer to create a boot menu, which is, at the very least, an inconvenience, because I have to boot up the CD to get to it.

item.title: Ticket #9608 (WebPositive: debug window) created
item.dc:creator: dsjonny
item.description: It would be very useful if the Web+ can show debug informations. It can be a very big help for web developers to optimize the site for Web+. For example: we would get info about javascript or css errors.

item.title: Ticket #9607 (WebPositive: print/save function) created
item.dc:creator: dsjonny
item.description: It would be useful if we can print / save a webpage with Web+. For save we can use similar way as printing to file: for example save to PDF.

item.title: Ticket #9572 (Haiku x86_64 built in Haiku x86_64 boots/crashes) closed
item.dc:creator: tqh
item.description: invalid

item.title: Ticket #9606 (Termcap: 'tput cols' always shows 80) created
item.dc:creator: zzzzz
item.description:
In Terminal 'tput cols' command always shows 80. No matter, if resized manually or by setting from the menu. Seems to me like hardcoded value.

On the other hand the output of 'tput cols' on Linux, say under konsole, after window having been resized is updated to the current value of terminal emulator window width in chars.

Tested on hrev45428 gcc4 x86, ticket filled as suggested on IRC by diver.

item.title: Ticket #9116 (liblocale.so: Bad port ID) closed
item.dc:creator: axeld
item.description:
fixed:

Well, thanks for the investigation in the first place! This actually will also fix a bug in my background branch at github where the client memory allocator may survive the death of the application.

item.title: Ticket #9605 (Web+ displays text documents as HTML) created
item.dc:creator: Kev
item.description:
E.g. ​ftp://ftp.mrunix.net/pub/webalizer/README is hard to read because linebreaks are treated as regular whitespace in HTML, but it's not an HTML page. Not sure how firefox does it but wrapping in a <pre> tag in such cases would be an easy way to increase usability.

hrev45413 gcc4h.

item.title: Ticket #9463 (WiFi auto-connect = ticket to jail) closed
item.dc:creator: diver
item.description:
fixed:

Fixed in hrev45435.

item.title: Ticket #9604 (PatchBay update for Haiku) created
item.dc:creator: Pete
item.description:
I've generated a new version of PatchBay, edited to conform (hopefully!) to Haiku coding standards, and using Haiku's ToolTip mechanism rather than the custom code in the original.

I've added a vector icon for the "Unknown Devices" it displays, and given it a Desktop icon as well.

This ticket is a follow-on from #9159, but following Philippe's suggestion there I've started a new ticket.

As noted there, this code should be in .../apps rather than .../tests/... so if it's OK, can someone please move it there in the repository?

item.title: Ticket #9603 (Built-in card reader KDLs when card inserted) created
item.dc:creator: Kev
item.description:
I have an eMachines T3104 (motherboard: ​VIA K8M800) with a card reader they describe as

"Media Reader: 8-in-1 digital media manager (Secure Digital (SD), Smart Media, Micro Drive, Memory Stick, Memory Stick Pro, Compact Flash, Mulitimedia Card, USB 2.0)"

When I insert an SD card that works fine on a Windows box, it turns on a green light (whether I've yet to get past the BIOS or not.)

In Haiku's DriveSetup on hrev45413 gcc4hybrid, the empty slots seem to show (see screenshot.) However, it doesn't let me mount or modify anything after inserting a card. Lately when I insert the card, I don't even get a chance to modify anything, because I get KDL'd with a division exception on "media checker".

I'm not sure if this has ever worked or what, and I only have Haiku and BeOS on this machine to work with.

item.title: Ticket #9602 (Tracker keyboard shortcut for location bar) created
item.dc:creator: Kev
item.description: Currently (hrev45413 gcc4h) in Tracker there's no way to move to the location bar without the mouse. Might I suggest Alt+L, a la Web+?

item.title: Ticket #9601 ([attansic_l1] crashes on boot) created
item.dc:creator: bob_ok
item.description:
Attansic L1 driver (Atheros L1 chip on ASUS M3A motherboard) crashes in KDL on boot and if I move/rename the driver, then after complete booting without the networking it goes into KDL again after I put driver file back and restart net_server.

Couldn't get syslog, so I took the photo.

item.description: WebM files are losing all the frames im Haiku. Audio works.

item.title: Ticket #9599 (Could not find codec parameters) created
item.dc:creator: Premislaus
item.description: I have BeOS_DemoVideo_20minutes (DivX).avi . MediaPlayer reads the file but it takes a lot of time. In two of three cases, the system is frozen for several seconds, and CPU utilization was 100%. Then I hear the sound, but the image loses a frames, it is also fast. In the VLC video is correct, but there is no sound.

item.title: Ticket #9598 (MediaPlayer crashed when copying a file.) created
item.dc:creator: Premislaus
item.description: While watching the video clip I decided to copy it to a flash stick. File size is 1.17 GiB. After copying approximately 900 MB, the copy process stopped, MediaPlayer crashed. Tracker has been blocked. I could not kill it and restart.

item.title: Ticket #9597 (After a certain time I lose sound.) created
item.dc:creator: Premislaus
item.description:
After a few hours of using Haiku, when I want to listen music, or watch movie, I have no sound! After boot sound works good. Restart of Media Services in Media preflet do not help.

I do not know from when this error occurs. Over the last few days I use Haiku many hours a day. That is probably why I notice this.

item.dc:creator: Kev
item.description:
On a blank workspace, open a Tracker window and then another program. Close the other program using Alt + W. The Tracker window should receive the focus, but it doesn't. hrev45413 gcc4hybrid.

From ​this discussion I wonder if instead of the desktop being avoided, all Tracker windows are being avoided, instead.

item.title: PackageManagement/TODO edited
item.dc:creator: bonefish
item.description:
Add MIME DB item.

(diff)

item.title: Ticket #9594 ([net_server] IPv6 Link Local prevents proper interface deletion) created
item.dc:creator: diver
item.description:
This is hrev45432.

ifconfig del /dev/net/ipro1000/0

deletes the interface from ifconfig, but leaves it in net_device_interfaces list.
So if one tries to bring back the interface he will get an error:

ifconfig /dev/net/ipro1000/0 up
ifconfig: Couldn't add interface: General system error

Removing /system/add-ons/kernel/network/protocols/ipv6 module
or commenting out ​_ConfigureIPv6LinkLocal fixes it.

item.title: Ticket #9593 (Bookmarks do not support long names.) created
item.dc:creator: Premislaus
item.description: This bug is easy to reproduce on the TuneTracker website.

item.title: Ticket #9028 (Something is wrong with the allocation of CPU time.) reopened
item.dc:creator: diver

item.title: Ticket #9592 ([Keymap] don't invalidate everything in KeyboardLayoutView) created
item.dc:creator: diver
item.description:
From ticket:8370#comment:13:

"The trick is to only invalidate the area that changed, and make your code in Draw() smart enough not to update everything everytime.
Which the ​KeyboardLayoutView currently doesn't do, though."

item.title: Ticket #9591 ([net_server] it shouldn't be possible to auto-config an interface with no ...) created
item.dc:creator: diver
item.description:
Currently ifconfig configures link-local address on interfaces with no link.

<mmlr_thinkpad> it's just buggy/not fully implemented
<mmlr_thinkpad> it doesn't actually check the link state
<mmlr_thinkpad> indeed for wireless networks this will have to be reworked anyway
<mmlr_thinkpad> or any network where link != usable
<mmlr_thinkpad> dailup, vpn for example
<mmlr_thinkpad> or maybe "link" should be reworked so that it actually means usable
<mmlr_thinkpad> for wireless link usually means an association with an ap is there
<mmlr_thinkpad> for wpa this doesn't mean that the link is actually usable though, because the wpa handshake needs to be completed first
<mmlr_thinkpad> usually you don't notice that as it's rather quick and the dhcp requests are simply retried
<mmlr_thinkpad> it's not exactly correct either way though

item.title: Ticket #9590 ([Network] preflet doesn't update the list of interfaces on the fly) created
item.dc:creator: diver
item.description:
This is hrev45428.

The Network preflet doesn't reflect changes to the list of interfaces.

To reproduce:

  • Open the preflet
  • ifconfig del /dev/net/ipro1000/0 ifconfig /dev/net/foo/0 up

Same applies to NetworkStatus.

item.title: Ticket #5957 (Network Preference crashes on Apply button on a system without network ...) closed
item.dc:creator: diver
